alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 12:36AM PST until December 07 at 9:52AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Cowlitz River At Randle affecting Lewis County. .Heavy rain has come to an end in the Central and Southern Washington Cascades early Wednesday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cowlitz River at Randle. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, the Cowlitz River will cause flooding from the vicinity of Randle downstream through Riffe Lake...inundating many roads including US Highway 12 and much of the farm lands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 20.5 feet. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.8 feet early Wednesday morning. The river will begin receding later Wednesday morning and drop below flood stage early Thursday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 845 AM PST.
